Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: Draw a simple fish with no distinct parts labeled (student may not know the specific parts).
Include some water around the fish, though without details (basic representation of a water habitat).
CANNOT: Correctly label parts of the fish's habitat, like plants or rocks (student doesn't know names or forgets to label).
Illustrate how the fish uses water to swim (student might not show any interaction between fish and water).
Include or label other plants or animals in the habitat (omits other organisms or shows incorrect animals, like land animals).
Illustrate how the fish's habitat provides necessary resources like air (omits air or doesn't connect resources to survival).
Show how the fish and environment work together as a system (no clear relationship shown).
